snippet: North Koreans have said many times over the years that they were disregarding the armistice ending the Korean War. What is unclear this time is whether they mean it.
abstract: News analysis; North Korea’s latest threats to annihilate its enemies have included a vow to scrap the 1953 armistice, the main legal document that theoretically stands in the way of a resumption of the Korean War; while the vow may be bluster, analysts who study North Korea are not so sure.

byline.contributor: Choe Sang-Hun contributed reporting from Seoul, South Korea.

lead_paragraph: North Koreans have said many times over the years that they were disregarding the armistice ending the Korean War. What is unclear this time is whether they mean it.

headline.main: Threats Sow Concerns Over Korean Armistice
headline.print_headline: Threats Sow Concerns Over Korean Armistice
